Detailed Description

Abstract Particle.

This class is a simple abstract base class for deriving particles. By overloading this class the user can create particles that can do anything they can imagine, even create other particles.

See also:
PhParticleSystem, PhEffector, PhEmitter

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

phoenix::PhParticle::PhParticle (  ) 

Constructor.

The defualt constructor initializes the type to zero and the partsys pointer to null. In order for your particle to be managed by the partsys, you must set the pointer and call PhParticleSystem::addParticle().

See also:
getType(), setType()

virtual phoenix::PhParticle::~PhParticle (  )  [virtual]

Destructor.

The default destructor calls PhParticleSystem::removeParticle() if partsys is not NULL. Usually you will not need to overload this, but you may want to overload destroy(). Please be aware that if you delete the particle without removing it from the particle system, your program will segfault.

See also:
destroy()

Member Function Documentation

virtual void phoenix::PhParticle::draw (  )  [virtual]

Draw function.

This function is called once every frame by the particle system during it's onRender() call, in this function you do all the particle behavior, including drawing itself.

See also:
destroy()

virtual void phoenix::PhParticle::destroy (  )  [virtual]

Destroy function.

This function is the prefered method of destroying a particle. By defualt this just makes the particle delete itself. However, overloading this can allow you to create other particles then this particle dies.

See also:
draw()

int phoenix::PhParticle::getType (  ) 

Get user-defined type.

This returns the type of the particle that was set by the user (defualt 0).

See also:
type

void phoenix::PhParticle::setType ( int  i  ) 

Set user-defined type.

This set the type of the particle (defualt 0).

See also:
type
